67e7fa8f-eb91-44d0-85ed-78b6eb4ccf8f.description: The Health & Wellness Coaching Certificate badge signifies that earners are prepared to help improve health and wellbeing for individuals, groups and organizations by utilizing evidence-based relational/behavior change skills and approaches in a variety of settings. Curriculum includes theory and practice in behavior change and coaching psychology, client-centered communication skills that facilitate self-directed change, evidence-informed process and structure, and the ethics of coaching.

Graduates of this program are eligible to apply for the HWC Certifying Examination to become National Board-Certified Health & Wellness Coach (NBC-HWC).

92c1bf60-d06d-41ff-a95b-cfc90f5e47bf.description: The Lean Continuous Improvement badge validates an individual’s ability to define the principles of Lean methodology, identify and eliminate waste, apply Lean concepts such as value stream mapping, spaghetti mapping and total productive maintenance, and understand how to plan and participate in a Kaizen event. Lean Continuous Improvement badge earners are prepared to identify the eight types of waste and successfully apply Lean tools to make impactful process improvements.

fece21df-e77a-43ff-bac9-2efd6ef9551e.description: In order to receive this badge, participants attended six workshops focused on leading to create a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. They have demonstrated a necessary attribute for any successful leader: equity-mindedness and a heart for inclusion. They are committed to making a positive impact within their teams and the broader Emory community, creating spaces of belonging where all can thrive.
fece21df-e77a-43ff-bac9-2efd6ef9551e.name: Leading with Equity

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in over 80% of Advancement and Alumni Engagement’s Leading with Equity Series: 5+ (out of 6) 2.5-hour workshops, committing 12-15 hours total class time.

Cultural Awareness and Humility: Participants were given the opportunity to more deeply engage by gaining skills to see and understand differences through the lens of their own values and belief systems. Workshop outcomes included establishment of norms and a deep dive into terminology and ideas that are foundational to this work.

Introduction to Implicit Bias: Session took a deeper dive into the scientific phenomenon of implicit bias—with particular attention to racial bias—the automatic, unconscious decisions that people make that are often biased against minoritized populations.

Introduction to Microaggressions: Workshop explored microaggressions: the everyday unconscious, subtle and often automatic put-downs and insults expressed toward a marginalized group by dominant culture. Session identified target, agent and bystander roles, and role- play ways to mitigate microaggressions with inclusion nudges and micro-affirmations.

Recognizing and Dismantling White Supremacy Culture at Work: Session introduced characteristics of white supremacy culture and how organizations unconsciously use the characteristics as the default way of being at work. Acknowledging these traits is the first step to creating a welcoming space for all to feel a sense of belonging.
Recruitment with an Equity Lens: Workshop explored tactical, practical and concrete ways to de-bias and improve processes and decision making relating to recruitment strategies.
Retention with an Equity Lens: Workshop explored tactical, practical & concrete ways to de-bias and improve processes and decision making, relating to retention strategies.

e70977a5-87c2-4aa6-8921-c2dfe066ae70.description: The Emory Office of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) awards the Institutional Strategic Planning Member badge to individuals selected for the 2021 strategic planning communities (SPCs). These community members served in an advisory capacity to Chief Diversity Officer, Dr. Carol E. Henderson, to create a draft of institutional strategic goals for DEI to be considered by University President, Gregory L. Fenves, in the development of the Emory Institutional DEI strategic plan and roadmap.
e70977a5-87c2-4aa6-8921-c2dfe066ae70.name: Emory University DEI Institutional Strategic Planning Member

badge_template_activities.title: Service on Emory University's Diversity, Equity, and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Institutional Strategic Planning Committee.

The courses completed in this program include: Strategic Communications, Effective Listening, Coaching Essentials, Conflict Management, Influence & Persuasion, and Leading Change.

4e3bcb8c-0793-400b-936a-563b98acd8f5.description: The Paralegal Certificate badge signifies the earner's ability to succeed in the legal profession as a professional paralegal. The skills represented by this badge include the ability to identify the ethical duties imposed on attorneys and paralegals, identify state and federal court systems and local jurisdictions, create discovery documents, conduct online legal research, compose a closed-legal memorandum, and recognize the requirements for a binding contract or a breach of contract.
4e3bcb8c-0793-400b-936a-563b98acd8f5.name: Paralegal Certificate

2d93ed93-7f07-4429-9ce8-e9f1d3d86b33.description: Earners of the Human Resources Management: Fostering an Inclusive and Equitable Culture Certificate have gained the foundational knowledge and skills necessary for Human Resources professionals. 90b6cf5d-9282-4e68-97ef-ec01ff7ff9cf.description: The Emory Office of Spiritual and Religious Life awards this badge to those who served on the Interfaith Strategic Planning Committee in 2021. These individuals served in an advisory capacity to Dean of Religious Life, The Rev. Dr. Greg McGonigle, to explore the history of Emory’s interfaith life and particular spiritual communities, assess their current status, brainstorm future opportunities, and recommend priorities to enhance spiritual and interfaith life at Emory.

Recommend priorities to enhance spiritual and interfaith life at Emory in the coming years.

9db1c8a8-024a-4bd5-9a7e-fb203415ba19.description: Trainees who earned this badge learned about active vs. passive learning, creating and improving course objectives, teaching, and assessments, and making the teaching environment a welcoming and supportive place for diverse students. badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Science Communication course offered by the Sci Comm Academy. Requirements: 1) Attend 4.5 hours of course meetings. 2) Create 256 character headline and topical outline that can be used to build a paper, article, speech, or presentation that will resonate with the audience and drive them to action.

4c981261-1fc1-48e1-b418-b728f7f77bba.description: Scientists who earn this badge learned how the press works and effective ways to engage with a reporter when discussing scientific topics in order to create a positive experience for both parties. Short Course of Science for Georgia, Inc.
4c981261-1fc1-48e1-b418-b728f7f77bba.name: Science Communication: Talking to the Media

alignments.name: National Postdoctoral Association (NPA) Core Competencies Developed: Communication Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Science Communication course offered by the Sci Comm Academy. Requirements: 1) Attend 1.5 hours of course meetings. 2) Create a topical outline about a newsworthy subject.

skills.name: Effective Outlines for Communicating with the Press

ae3189b9-cfde-4093-8754-4003a96c7d91.description: This badge has been earned by Teachers Retirement System of Georgia Retirement Coordinators who have completed a series of four courses: Managing Difficult Conversations and Situations, Personal Brand, Supervising Effectively, and Better Business Writing. Earners have gained key competencies in self-awareness, audience based writing techniques, de-escalation communication methods, and supervisory training.
ae3189b9-cfde-4093-8754-4003a96c7d91.name: TRS Retirement Coordinator 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Managing Difficult Conversations and Situations course.
Complete the Personal Brand course.
Complete the Supervising Effectively course.
Complete the Better Business Writing course.

450ba621-4447-4524-827a-706f8ec825b1.description: The Big Data Analytics and Applied Machine Learning with Python Certificate badge validates that you as the earner have gained hands-on experience in the entire machine learning spectrum, including data wrangling, visualization, data exploration, algorithm selection, modeling, training, testing, and implementation. Badge earners are prepared to generate actionable intelligence from diverse datasets (structured, text, web, and time series) for various practical applications.
450ba621-4447-4524-827a-706f8ec825b1.name: Big Data Analytics and Applied Machine Learning with Python Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 90% of live class sessions
Complete the capstone project and final exam with an average score of 70% or higher

0cf3a556-8a7e-4438-98a5-2cbee7aa78dd.description: The Business Intelligence Certificate badge validates that you as the earner are prepared to enter this thriving professional field. Major components of the program include data collection, data preprocessing, data storage, basic data mining, descriptive data analytics, data visualization, and results presentation. Included in the coursework, earners practically applied learned concepts to real-world cases and formed data analytics teams to solve business problems and identify solutions.
0cf3a556-8a7e-4438-98a5-2cbee7aa78dd.name: Business Intelligence Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve a minimum cumulative score of 75% on the projects and exam
Commit at least 8 hours per week to complete all class assignments before attending Saturday classes
Attend at least 90% of live class sessions

83534ff5-cb9b-4eb2-b771-295390b6f9ae.description: Designed in partnership with AWS Academy, the DevOps Bootcamp equips earners with the skills employers are looking for in automation, infrastructure, and Python. The program includes labs and courseware from both Fullstack and AWS Academy, blended into a unique fast-track student experience to train earners from beginner to certified devops engineer in 26 weeks.
83534ff5-cb9b-4eb2-b771-295390b6f9ae.name: DevOps Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: Earner successfully attends all required course hours and completes all program materials including any required group and/or individual projects

45242b53-62bd-43c3-bd47-9690616f6bac.description: The Digital Marketing Certificate badge validates that the earner has gained the fundamental knowledge and skills necessary to work in the field. Badge earners are versed in digital marketing concepts and strategies, storytelling as a blueprint for branding, and multichannel campaigns including marketing briefs, goals, KPIs, messaging, positioning, audience segmentation, competitive analyses, and analytics reporting. Badge earners have completed a capstone and can develop a marketing portfolio.
45242b53-62bd-43c3-bd47-9690616f6bac.name: Digital Marketing Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 80% of live class sessions
Earn an average passing score of 75% or higher on quizzes
Complete the capstone project with a score of 75% or higher

8c842f35-00cb-43b6-bf97-a8b246d00011.description: The Emory Office of Spiritual and Religious Life awards this badge to those who served on the Buddhist Life Working Group in 2021-2022. These individuals served in an advisory capacity to Dean of Religious Life, The Rev. Dr. Greg McGonigle, to explore the history of Buddhist life at Emory, assess its current status, brainstorm future opportunities, and recommend priorities to enhance Buddhist life at Emory to better serve all students, faculty, staff, and alumni.
8c842f35-00cb-43b6-bf97-a8b246d00011.name: Emory University Buddhist Life Working Group Member

badge_template_activities.title: Active membership on the Emory University Buddhist Life Working Group.

Volunteer to serve in an advisory capacity in one or more of the following ways: 1. Explore the history of Buddhist life at Emory; 2. Assess the current status of Buddhist life at Emory; 3. Brainstorm future opportunities for Buddhist life at Emory; 4. Recommend priorities to enhance Buddhist life at Emory to better serve all students, faculty, staff, and alumni.

6fe53f3f-0d9c-4db6-90df-51e29329a065.description: The Graphic Design & Visual Communications Certificate badge validates that the earner has learned the foundational principles and elements of good design, including color theory, composition, typography, and more. Program modules included visual communication, the role and duties of a graphic designer, road mapping, the power and effects of branding, digital vs. print delivery, staying ahead of future tech, and critical skills for graphic designers in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
6fe53f3f-0d9c-4db6-90df-51e29329a065.name: Graphic Design & Visual Communications Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 80% of live class sessions
Complete all assignments with a grade of 75% or higher.

cf18f781-17f1-4302-ab9c-b47c18b61100.description: The Interior Decorating & Home Staging Certificate badge validates that the earner has gained the fundamental knowledge and skills in decorating principles and home staging to create beautiful and functional spaces in the home. Topics covered include foundational design styles, accessorizing, color theory, illusion design, combining fabric patterns, furniture, home staging, and green design. Badge earners utilized the knowledge gained to create a design board capstone project.
cf18f781-17f1-4302-ab9c-b47c18b61100.name: Interior Decorating & Home Staging Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 80% of live class sessions
Complete the final capstone project with a passing score of 75% of higher

f35275b8-178a-4d9d-8a57-c2d9db2a6f98.description: The Management Certificate badge validates that the earner has gained the foundational skills necessary to succeed as an effective manager. Through a combination of instructor-led and self-paced coursework, earners have completed modules including strategic communications, emotional intelligence, personal branding, coaching and delegation, developing employee performance, effective listening, giving and receiving feedback, managing diverse behavioral styles, and managing conflict and change.
f35275b8-178a-4d9d-8a57-c2d9db2a6f98.name: Management Certificate: Classic Skills and Modern Challenges

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 80% of live class sessions
Complete all self-paced work and earn a passing score of 75% or higher on all quizzes
Complete an action plan presentation

2a9f47bc-af15-48af-b2ee-287bd94361f4.description: Curiosity is a core innovation skill: without a sense of wonder, you are unlikely to identify problems you want to solve or to develop the skills to solve them. Understanding problems from different angles and applying solutions from one area of life to another leads to new insights and novel solutions. Develop your innovation curiosity by studying the innovation topics and themes of greatest interest to you within a wide array of content curated by The Hatchery.
2a9f47bc-af15-48af-b2ee-287bd94361f4.name: The Hatchery Skills Builder: Innovation Curiosity

badge_template_activities.title: Earner successfully completed all online course materials and assignments
Earner completed a synthesis reflection
Earner completed at least 4 hours of course content
